Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Grant's Mom
Reviews.Content: I have used Olympus cameras in the past without any complaints.  This camera holds up to our expectations.  The picture quality is amazing.  The scene modes perform well, but we don't use them that often, we prefer to point and shoot with the auto-mode.  This camera is replacing a 3MP nikon coolpix, that finally wore out.  Just remember when you buy this camera, it is a pocket sized digital camera for around $100.  Don't expect to be taking photos for National Geographic!!  It is a great little camera  :)

Reviews.Title: Could use one extra mode in scenes
Reviews.Author: C. B. Fagan
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice camera-especially for under $90. One thing I failed to check before purchasing is the various scene modes. Unfortunately, living in Florida requires a mode for Beach scenes, and this doesn't appear to have one-but it does have many others. The display is quite good and compares well to the Canon A590IS. The on-screen menu is good-fairly intuitive. The instruction manual is available on disc (provided) or can be downloaded and saved from the Olympus site (pdf). You do not need the proprietary imaging software provided-Windows Photo Gallery or Picasa does just as well. The rechargeable lithium-ion battery appears to hold its charge very well-it is not rechargeable in the camera, but comes with a swivel wall plug charger and is easy to use. Battery removal/insertion is easy. Haven't used the micro SD adapter yet, so can't comment on that. The camera is described as "dark gray", but is actually clad in a highly reflective- almost mirror like-finish. It does show fingerprints as a result, but they are easily avoided by being careful or removing with a semi-damp cloth. It was a good purchase for the money. Olympus seems to make a very good product, both in terms of build and image quality.

Reviews.Title: Dissapointed
Reviews.Author: Gerald
Reviews.Content: I was excited to get this camera because the reviews seemed pretty good. I was disappointed in the picture quality and would have sent it back but needed it for vacation right away. The video is not very good and most pictures seem fuzzy and have lighting issues. It does have quite a few settings and I may be able to get some better pictures but I wanted a decent point and shoot. This wasn't it. It does have some pros. I like the lithium battery, the screen is nice and clear, the menu is fairly easy to navigate, the video uses Windows Media Player not Quicktime like a lot of cameras, and it's nice and slim so it fits in a pocket well. Not enough to make me reccomment it though.

Reviews.Title: I love my Olympus FE-4000
Reviews.Author: Kingsley W. Nash
Reviews.Content: This is  my second FE-4000; I broke my first one.  After reading all the negative reviews, I feel that this camera has gotten a bum rap!  It has most of the features of much more expensive models and is a trememdous bargain.  As for it's performance all you have to do is learn how to make the proper settings and have the patience to wait for the Auto-focus target box to turn green before shooting.  If setting the best shooting mode and scenes is to much for you, just use the "iAUTO" mode and everything is automatically selected for you.  But you can't just take this camera out of the box point & shoot.  The biggest problem I had was trying to figure out the hopelessly inadequate operating manual supplied on disk by the manufacturer.  It is worse than the IRS tax code.  I just studied one button at a time until I figured out all the functions for myself.  KING NASH

Reviews.Title: bad news - good news
Reviews.Author: Bbeth
Reviews.Content: I have always liked Olympus and bought this thinking it must be OK.  It is a nice looking camera,small, nice display, good user interface.  Bad news is it takes lousy pictures, fuzzy and out of focus. i've tried all the resolutions from 12M down to 1M and normal and fine compressions.  i've tried in bright light, dim, with flash, without flash and in all the modes from antishake to face detect etc.  all the pictures look slightly out of focus.  there is no manual focus so there's no way to make it better.  read the other reviews before you buy but i'm disappointed in Olympus for letting this out under their name.

Reviews.Title: Terrible Camera
Reviews.Author: Red Robin
Reviews.Content: This camera takes the most awful pictures I've ever seen.  It was more like a toy camera than anything else.  I was sadly disappointed upon receiving it and immediately sent it back and bought another one.  I recommend Kodak, Sony, or Samsung.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Tracey Hardberger
Reviews.Content: I gave this to my daughter for her 13th b-day and she loved it!  This camera takes excellent quality pictures, both still and movement.  I am very impressed with this product.  Thank you.

Reviews.Title: Trust The Reviews
Reviews.Author: J. Taylor
Reviews.Content: Typically I read the reviews and just go with gut instinct. Most of the reviews here are bad, and here I am adding another one. I got the camera to replace the Fe 4010 model my cat poured water all over. I figured they look the same, just a model number off, how could it hurt? I got the camera very fast, and was so excited, and could tell from the very first shot, it wasn't what I wanted. The shot was blurry, doesnt adjust well to light, and has a hard time focusing. So very disappointed because I loved my other model that took pictures so much better. Now I have the pain of having to pack it all up and return it and order the other model from Best Buy. Read the reviews, I am in no way a photographer, but I know a bad shot when I see one.

Reviews.Title: Not a good camera
Reviews.Author: Melissa A. Masino "Melissa Masino"
Reviews.Content: I had a sony cybershot that had mechanical issues after owning it for 2 years, so I was looking for a cheap camera with features relative to my old camera.  Since my other one started having issues after the warranty, I didn't want to spend a lot of money on a new camera and to fix the old one, it would've cost me $100.  This Olympus Camera is very hard to use. I miss the wheel on the cybershot that gives you the features right away.  With the Olympus, you have to use the menu feature and search for the settings you want.  It is not a point and click camera.  If you point and click indoors, your pictures will not come out well if there's not enough light. Don't listen to the hype about the 'i-auto' feature.  It does nothing good for you.  It doesn't instantly focus or fix the lighting settings.  My pictures were mostly grainy and blurry.  I'd recommend you buy something else.  Not worth the price. Not easy to use.

Reviews.Title: horrible
Reviews.Author: CamDaniels
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera over a year ago. I had just had my first child and wanted a new camera to capture all the amazing things she was learning everyday. So I looked into some cameras and bought this one. Big mistake! Its horrible. The pictures came out horrible. I've had a few point and shoot cameras - so I played with the setting and tried to figure out why I couldn't get a decent picture. It was just the camera. It also isn't really pink at all. Its a really dark mucky color. I ended up with my sister in law's old camera. Which is a waaay better camera. I gave the Olympus to my daughter as a toy. She likes having a camera like mommy. Too bad it was a 150 dollar toy! Don't waste your money.

Reviews.Title: Basic, takes ok photos
Reviews.Author: David Siebenheller "dave"
Reviews.Content: Very basic and light camera, perfect for putting in your pocket and taking family snaps. Uses an XD memory card (or micro-SD), which is why I bought it, but may not fit your needs. Other reviewers said it takes "out of focus" photos. This is incorrect. If you just mash on the shutter, yes, the photo will probably be out of focus. But if you pre-focus, by pressing the shutter halfway until you hear the beep, (as most digital cameras instruct), the photos come out fine. You only get a quick start sheet; the full manual is a download.

Reviews.Title: big disappointment
Reviews.Author: rufus6642
Reviews.Content: I'd been in the market for a new camera for a while and was so excited when I got the FE4000 for my birthday because I had read a lot of good reviews, but it was really disappointing. As for point and shoot, hopeless. For real, cant get a decent shot unless i spend a minute adjusting the settings. As for asking strangers to take pictures of your group, embarrassing. the picture is so grainy adn poorly lit that they have to take several pictures to get a decent one. Im really tired of my special moments not being appropriately captured by this camera and will probably be getting a new one soon.It does have some pros. About every third picture i get an amazing one. And everytime i transfer the photos to my computer, they look much better than they did on the tiny camera screen. So if you know how to mess with the settings you can get really good photos, but I still would never recommend this camera to anyone

Reviews.Title: Very Awesome
Reviews.Author: More Than Conquerors Through Him
Reviews.Content: I wanted a digital camera around a 100 dollars. And I am fully satisfied with this one. A lot has been said about the picture quality and lighting and BLA BLA... but if you know how to use the options, it takes really good pictures. Besides.. its a 100$ camera!! Not a professional HD camcorder...The VIDEO quality can be turned up to an incredible quality, and with the 2gig card maxes out at under 20 min of video. Nice if you want to make home videos in good quality.I am very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Slim and good looking, horrible picture quality.
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because it looked pretty in the store catalog. However, I was an idiot and did not check to see how the image quality was of the pictures it takes. All of the pictures seem to make the background darker than it really is, and you cannot change it! The design is excellent; the screen of reasonable size. If only the image quality was better...

Reviews.Title: What I expected for $100.
Reviews.Author: Henry Hacking
Reviews.Content: This camera is the worst Point and Shoot I've ever owned.  It takes a picture, and that is really where the buck stops.  iAuto on this thing is retarded.  'P' mode is just terrible; it actually makes the pictures worse.  It's a pretty flimsy frame too.  ANY excess light makes the photo terrible.  The reduction settings are weak, and as expected, the manual shutter speed settings are useless.  Also, the 'Shaky Hand Adjustment' feature does virtually nothing.  I love my P&S; cameras, but this one is terrible for it.  Every single photo takes three to four seconds to actually capture.  In my honest opinion, this is the worst waste of $100 I've ever experienced.  DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA!  The ultra-low price is NOT worth it.  Not knocking my sweet dear Amazon, but this product really got my goad.

Reviews.Title: its ok.
Reviews.Author: Gladys Johnston
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace my old one for a concert i was going too.it takes pretty good pictures in the daylight but in a dark arena the pictures turn out grainy no matter what settings you use.overall its a pretty good camera.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Jay E. Jones
Reviews.Content: great little camera. hasnt been used much yet as it was a Christmas gift to my girlfriend, but so far it has worked great.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: David Jensen
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my wife for Christmas - she kept saying that she wanted a slim little camera that she could easily stuff in her pocket that takes good photos. It is very compact, and she has been thrilled with the quality of the pictures thus far. She takes it with her wherever she goes now.For the price I paid, I think it's a very good, very portable point-and-shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera, no matter what the others said...
Reviews.Author: J. Cressey
Reviews.Content: I happened upon this camera purely by accident at a local store as I has planned to purchase a different brand camera.  The other brand was the same price but 10 megapixels versus this one's 12 and had fewer features.  One of the reviewers commented on the lack of a beach setting, being in Maine this is less of a concern but I was impressed by the wide range of other point and shoot selections as well as the ability to choose from seven different camera speeds.  The price is great when you also factor in the fact that it comes with a rechargeable li-ion battery and charger unit.  All in all I am very impressed with the camera and the photos it takes.  I have not had any issues with poor picture quality, everything is crisp and clear.

Reviews.Title: Awful excuse for a camera.
Reviews.Author: Hana
Reviews.Content: No matter how you set the settings, the picture quality is grainy, the LCD screen is awful, and it isn't easy to use. Don't even think about taking decent pictures in anything other than full sunlight--this camera chokes in lower light.  We were so dissapointed with this camera that we bought another Cannon two months after we bought this.  We should have just bought a Cannon to begin with!

Reviews.Title: Not as good as my other Olympus (Stylus 1200)
Reviews.Author: Joseph J. Gannon "Eurotourist"
Reviews.Content: But, a great pocket sized lightweight camera. XP Card adapter that comes with neatly hold a miscro SD card (on you!)

Reviews.Title: OK, but not GREAT!
Reviews.Author: C. Welker
Reviews.Content: I actually sent this camera back.  My last two cameras were Canon and I loved them.  I couldn't afford to replace the Canon that I had that was stolen, so I decided to take a chance on this one.  The picture quality wasn't as good as I was used to having with my previous cameras.I did like the size of the camera and the features though.

Reviews.Title: ugh!
Reviews.Author: sarah
Reviews.Content: If you want every photo you take to look like it's from a 70's cookbook then by all means buy this camera. No matter how much I tweaked the settings everything comes out with a tint of brown/gold! boo.

Reviews.Title: I hate it
Reviews.Author: Gran Papa "two guns and one bullet"
Reviews.Content: unfortunately this is the worst camera I've seen, the purchase and the disappointment was so great that sold two weeks before, personally I do not taste like pulling the photos, videos anything I liked. I'll never try this brand for the cameras.

Reviews.Title: Buy new batteries after only 6 months
Reviews.Author: Wong
Reviews.Content: Terrible camera pictures are fuzzy takes a long time to recognize faces.Tried calling olympus support line they told me to buy a new battery that cost from THEIR website only that cost $22 I told them to go to hellNEVER buy from olympus

Reviews.Title: What Are They Talking About??
Reviews.Author: Bookz.4.U "JMWCSC"
Reviews.Content: This really is a great camera...the only downside is that you have to buy an xD card for it. But it takes great pictures & does exactly what it needs to do. I would buy it again!

Reviews.Title: awful camera
Reviews.Author: queens village buyer
Reviews.Content: Please don't buy this camera.... The pics dont come out the way a 12mp cameras pics should come out.  It looks very nice but am totally unhappy with camera functions and picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Picture quality: Barely Acceptable
Reviews.Author: DmF "DmF"
Reviews.Content: Needing a shirt-pocketable camera with a wide-angle zoom, this seemed a logical choice despite the many lackluster reviews. After a series of test shots covering most of the camera's features, with and without flash, it's becomes clear that Olympus fell down on the job here. There must have been no quality control on this model or else they just didn't care. I would rate the final picture quality beside that of a 1960s Kodak Instamatic. Even after tweaking the final images using Photoshop CS5, they were still only slightly better than awful. Colors are not even close to true and sharpness fails at every zoom setting.This camera should be selling in the $30 range so that buyers will know about what they are getting.The over all size is great and it is a feature rich point and shoot with a very nice 26mm widest zoom setting. Too bad the output is so substandard. Shame on you Olympus!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Point-and-Shoot!
Reviews.Author: Miss 1337
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for price, and quality. It's VERY lightweight, slender and portable. The picture quality is great, don't let those 1-2 star reviews discourage you (I've tested this camera in various settings). This is a camera designed basic point-and-shoot, not something for professional work of course. I've used an Olympus Stylus 710 in the past, loved it and decided to get my own Olympus camera. I highly recommend this camera if you're wanting something that won't break the budget, easily portable, and takes great photos.

Reviews.Title: Olympus FE 4000 camera
Reviews.Author: sschase
Reviews.Content: Wonderful camera, takes great pictures and has a video mode that you can make videos with as well.  Got this one for my daughter and she loves it!

Reviews.Title: Its all good
Reviews.Author: mabdulb
Reviews.Content: Good Camera. Was a Sony lover before and wanted to try this brand...turned out to be a decent choice...at an excellent price. Amazon pricing is awesome.

Reviews.Title: Dissapointed in picture quality
Reviews.Author: Art Evans
Reviews.Content: All our pictures come out fuzzy. I thought it was me but all the pictures my wife and daughter took came out the same. I don't like the pause before the actual picture is taken either.

Reviews.Title: Shoddy camera, fake warranty
Reviews.Author: Michael Potts
Reviews.Content: Olympus cameras USED to be excellent -- this was my fourth one, bought entirely on the basis of my previous experience. How wrong I was!  The camera is slow to focus, and focuses inaccurately. It is GLACIALLY slow to take a picture -- you know, you push the button, and when an engineer in Japan decides it's time to take the picture, the camera clicks. Usually (but not always.)  Maybe I had a lemon, but the macro capability was ...well, incapable. Color was okay, but side-by-side comparison with my older FE-230 showed inaccurate and spotty rendering. The overall feel of the camera was cheap and shaky -- I should have trusted my fingers on initial examination! Lesson learned.  But Olympus's race to the bottom came home most depressingly when the camera broke -- one morning, after the lens came out to play, it wouldn't retract -- and I sent it back for warranty repairs, and my warranty was deemed invalid due to impact damage. Fair enough, had there been an impact, but there wasn't. Previous Olympus cameras sustained serious shocks -- this is a pocket camera, after all! -- and kept on clicking.  DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA. Even for under $90 it is no bargain. Olympus's quality trimming and mean spirited warranty administration make it a risky buy.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money this piece of junk
Reviews.Author: Surjit Singh Purewal
Reviews.Content: This camera is piece of junk. So donot waste your money on it. After few months of use the lens stop extending out. Try to call olympus twice but the wait time was so long that had to hang up....

Reviews.Title: Junk!
Reviews.Author: D. White
Reviews.Content: What a piece of junk!  Please don't waste your money on this camera.  I bought this camera for a trip, before there were any reviews, and regret it everyday.  The photos are ALL awful, grainy, and a lot of them out of focus.  No matter what settings I used the photos weren't crisp or even clear. I contacted Olympus about this camera and they weren't any help.  In fact they wanted ME to pay $10 to ship it to them to see what's wrong with the camera, when in reality it's a bad camera, bad design.  The camera now sits on my shelf and has been replaced by a nikon point and shoot that I am MUCH happier with.  Even my elementary school aged kids don't want to use it since the photos are not print quality, not even in 4x6's.  Shame on Olympus for making such a piece of junk!

Reviews.Title: Portable, but not worth the money
Reviews.Author: L. Patterson "larain"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera so that I could have a point-and-shoot and maybe take a few nice scenics if the chance arose. The portability of this camera is great... I can slip it into the back pocket of my jeans or into the PDA pocket of my purse easily. The design is nice although prone to dirty fingerprints. The screen is nice and clear and the menu is easy to navigate as well.As for the downsides, picture quality isn't what I expected from an Olympus. Granted, it's quite affordable, but even then I expect some degree of clear photos. I have tried every setting in both indoor and outdoor environments and it takes a long time to figure out which works best for which type of lighting/landscape, and my biggest complaint is that it blurs easily. I can be standing as still as I can with the steady-hand setting on, try to take a picture of a group of people, and the slightest movement of my body will turn the entire photo into a blur.A nice-looking camera for the money, but it's worth it to spring for one with better quality photos.

Reviews.Title: I agree what It's awful camera...
Reviews.Author: Jieun Choi "jun"
Reviews.Content: It's terrible.... the pic quality ....... oh my god.. even it was better my camera which i bought 6 years ago..It's broken now...

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY - HORRIBLE
Reviews.Author: A. Tom "ibuytoys"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take pictures of my children.  It is an AWFUL camera! The delay is about 1 minute long.  By the time the camera takes a picture of my kids they have already moved.  You get what you pay for, so invest a little more money if you plan on taking pictures of something that moves/breathes.

Reviews.Title: Not Happy With Pictures At All
Reviews.Author: V. Girard
Reviews.Content: Awful camera. We returned this after trying really hard to like the camera. At first I thought it was because I was just use to out Kodak camera, so I kept trying different settings and taking multiple pictures. Most pictures were of my daughter and granddaughter and the camera was slow to take the picture, blurry and dark. We were looking to upgrade from our Kodak 8 mp to a 12 mp because we felt the Kodak wasn't taking as good of pictures as we thought it should after it got wet (totally our doing). I even went as far as to say that maybe the prints would turn out better than it looked on the computer, um, no.  When I got my prints and was looking at them as I came across one that was crisp and bright I realized that it was from our old camera not the new one, so we returned it.

Reviews.Title: Great price, poor picture quality
Reviews.Author: Juan C. Chairez "camexch"
Reviews.Content: My daughter wanted to have a camera for herself for this Christmas. I went over digital cameras all over the internet and found the best prices in Amazon. Then I found the Olympus FE-400 with 12mp for less $[...]! I had one Olympus camera before with which I had a great experience. It took great quality pictures, performed flawlessly and it even worked underwater. So I didn't think about it twice when I saw the price for this Olympus camera.Now I see the reason why it is so inexpensive. I even have an argument that my Nokia N95 8g's 5mp camera takes better quality pictures.Fortunately for me, this camera is not the family camera, it is my daughter's camera who is 6 years old and at least I know she will be happy with it.My recommendation is, buy a Nikon or Canon camera. These have proven to me to be the best cameras out there, and I have had several cameras throughout the years to know what I am talking about.Current owner of a Nikon D90 and Canon PowerShot A1000 IS

Reviews.Title: Not the usual Olympus quality
Reviews.Author: Mosey
Reviews.Content: Purchased 12/09 as Christmas present. Moderate use, every few weeks, not daily. After 5 months the lens would not extend. Sent back for repair under warranty, I had to pay shipping. Camera came back after about 2 weeks, turned it on and lens would now extend but would not retract. Expressed my concern for sloppy repair via Olympus website and arranged for another repair. Again, I had to pay for shipping. Never received any apology or explanation from Olympus. Got camera back in few weeks and it did work fine. Then dropped it and broke LCD panel...Dang. Picture quality was ok, not great. Size was best feature. Nice, small and sleek. Debating whether to send in for new LCD or just trash it. I've owned many cameras, including Olympus and this is not the service, product or quality i have come to expect from Olympus.

Reviews.Title: Olympus FE 400 Review
Reviews.Author: Sree "Sree"
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera for the price. It has image stabilization and a large screen. It takes awesome pictures and suits even novice users! Excellent buy!

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: xyy0219
Reviews.Content: This is a camera that shines from inside out. Looks good at a ultra low price.

Reviews.Title: Small cameras...  mmmm...bad
Reviews.Author: S. Rayne "Unit44"
Reviews.Content: Well I have a larger Panasonic that takes great pictures in any condition but the wife wanted a small camera that we could throw in a pocket and take with us easier.  I have the "small frame" pocket cameras at work (several models) and none of them take good point and shoot pictures with out messing with settings and holding them real still. So when I looked for a camera like this for personal use I wanted one that was not so hard to work with for a good picture, all the reviews (here and other sites) said this was a great small camera..... well mostly...  it still needs a lot of work on your part to take good pictures unless you are outside on a sunny day.  I am very disappointed in how it takes indoor photos and if anyone has found the pocket camera that actually works please point me in the right direction as this is not the one.

Reviews.Title: Poor Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: David Marquardt
Reviews.Content: Very poor picture quality with this camera, you might think you're saving money buying this one instead of a nicer model for 30-50 dollars more but you sacrifice a ton of quality -- don't buy this one.

Reviews.Title: Steer Clear!!
Reviews.Author: latka-wodka "korkumi"
Reviews.Content: Hands down awful camera. Why Olympus would even put this on the market is a mystery to me. Very poor display quality, photo quality is better on my 6mp Nikon CoolPix of 5 years ago!! It feels cheap in all areas. All buttons and casing, Very lightweight and flimsy. This is not a camera I would recommend to even a beginner. We returned the camera fairly soon after testing it out. Great price.. sure... total waste of every cent though...so BUYER BEWARE!!! Steer Clear of this one...

Reviews.Title: poor camera, don't waste money
Reviews.Author: Marilyn L. Marks
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review about any item. I bought this for my daughter after much research. She is in college and takes many pictures. I wish I could send this camera back. I have tried everything to make the pictures so they are not blurry. When people move, they are blurry. Don't waste your money. They should take this off the market.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this product!
Reviews.Author: S. WALSH "Former  Olympus camers lover"
Reviews.Content: We returned this product and were not happy with this purchase.The price was right, but the camera was terrible.

Reviews.Title: Light in weight and price
Reviews.Author: Joseph J. Gannon "Eurotourist"
Reviews.Content: Purchased as a second camera. A little more difficult to handle the settings (from from Stylus 1200).

Reviews.Title: olympus FE-4000 12 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Viola Adams "Picture gone wild"
Reviews.Content: The Olumpus Fe-4000 camra is for teen too small fot me. I returned the camera I haven't received my refund. 2 months ago.....

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, picture quality varies
Reviews.Author: Krissy
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera for our 9 year old daughter who is interested in photography.  I love the size and portability of the camera.  It's very easy to use for my daughter, but the quality of pictures isn't always the best...often turning out blurry or dark (even when my husband and I use it).  We did research before buying this camera and read similiar reviews.  Overall, we are pleased with the camera for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: OK camera
Reviews.Author: C. C. Huynh "vegasrehab"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for the wide lens...picture quality not as good as my old Canon.  Should have bought the Canon Rebel SLR camera....bt for the price, it's not bad.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: A. Caipa "pcs"
Reviews.Content: I'm a college student and by no means am I a professional photographer. However, the first thing I noticed about this camera was the awful picture quality. The camera itself is equipped with a appreciable number of settings but none of them seem to affect the quality of the picture! What use is a 12MP camera if the vibrancy of the colors of the scene being taken is crappy quality? The video setting does not have sound and the flash is concentrated in one area rather than lighting up the entire scene. Photos taken in a dark setting are awful even when on the indoor setting. The one good thing about this camera is the thin width and light weight: two qualities that make the camera manageable and able to be carried around with ease.Overall, I was so disappointed with the camera that I actually returned it. I will definitely not be gambling with an olympus camera again.

Reviews.Title: Too much plastic
Reviews.Author: J. Katz "jameswk"
Reviews.Content: Very cheaply made feels like a kids toy camera. Returned it and bought a different one.

Reviews.Title: Only buy for a child
Reviews.Author: Rebekah Robinson "NCRobinson"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife, and we were very disappointed by the picture quality.  It's true, you get what you pay for...

Reviews.Title: My Phone takes better pictures
Reviews.Author: RestlessinPhoenix "RiP"
Reviews.Content: I may be a bit spoiled by my Canon S5IS camera (which is an in-between SLR and P&S; camera)but my wife received this camera for Christmas. When she received it I was a bit hesitant because I was going to buy her a P&S; for her birthday soon after Christmas and I did extensive research for smaller P&S; cameras.First - I didn't come with a memory card...which I am not sure any cameras these days come with any but they are pretty cheap these days. So just an FYI...buy a XD or MicroSD card.Second, I have been fiddling with the settings and well...the pictures are still very bad. My camera phone takes much sharper crisper pictures and it is half of the megapixels plus it is a phone ...so it's main job is phone calls not pictures...pretty sad that a reputable camera company is putting out Chinese garbage.Remember: trust reviews (especially the majority's opinion) on Amazon and megapixels don't mean anything when the photo is awful to begin with.

ProductInfo.Features:
12-megapixel resolution for photo-quality prints up to 20 x 30 inches
4x wide-angle optical zoom; 2.7-inch LCD
AF Tracking technology; choose from three in-camera Magic Filters
Edit images in-camera; Red-Eye Fix, Lighting Fix, Resizing and Cropping
Capture images to xD-Picture Card or microSD (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Olympus FE-4000 12MP Digital Camera with 4x Wide Angle Optical Zoom and 2.7 inch LCD (Pearl White)
